entry.title: Dynamic Font Styling in Adobe Forms (JavaScript)
entry.content:
Introduction:
In many business scenarios, Adobe Forms need to highlight specific information dynamically—such as marking certain values in bold, keeping others in normal, or changing the emphasis based on data conditions. Instead of hard-coding text styles, we can control the font style at runtime using simple logic. This approach makes the form more readable, user-friendly, and aligned with business rules.

while assigning font style in adobe forms we have provision to select font style thats applied each of the data, but what if i has to maintain dynamically means based on condition? this blog will gives solution.

Solution Overview:
To implement dynamic font styling in Adobe Forms, the value to be evaluated is passed into the form, and a small JavaScript condition is added in the text field’s event (such as initialize or exit). In this script, the field’s value is checked, and based on the condition, the font weight is adjusted at runtime. For example, if the value equals “GTARLANA,” the script sets the text to bold, otherwise it applies a normal font style. This simple logic allows the form to adapt its appearance dynamically without modifying the layout each time a new rule is introduced.

if ( this.rawValue === "GTARLANA" ){
       this.font.weight = "bold"
       };
       else{
       this.font.weight = "normal" };

Output:

 

When condition Satisfied

 

When condition not Satisfied

 



Conclusion:
Dynamic font styling in Adobe Forms provides a clean way to highlight important data without complicating the form layout. By controlling style through conditions, you maintain a single design while achieving dynamic visual emphasis. This approach is simple, reusable, and enhances the clarity of printed business documents.

entry.title: Re: How can I get a complete list of sub-scope items prog...
entry.content:
Hello,

Sorry for the delay in getting back to you,

If this is still relevant, the most effective "single downloadable file" approach is to use a structured export report directly from SAP Signavio Process Manager, as this is the primary source for detailed process modeling. You should use the Process Characteristics Report with Detailed Elements from SAP Signavio Process Manager.  This report generates an Excel file (XLS) containing a structured, tabular view of all elements and attribute values within the selected diagrams.

This report will also help you to get the applications (Apps) and roles associated with each process step (sub-scope item), you rely on the same comprehensive data sources used above, provided that the required linkages are maintained as attributes or relationships in your tools.

For this to work efficiently, the roles and applications must be modeled as attributes (standard or custom) associated with the respective BPMN elements (tasks, sub-processes, etc.) in SAP Signavio Process Manager.

 

If your organization relies on SAP LeanIX to model the complex relationships between processes, applications, and roles (a key function of Enterprise Architecture Management), using its APIs is the best programmatic approach:
SAP LeanIX Data Model: The process structure (sub-scope items) is documented on the Business Context Fact Sheet, and these Fact Sheets can be explicitly linked to:
    ◦ Applications (Apps): Using the direct relationship between Business Context (Process) and Application Fact Sheets.
    ◦ Roles: Roles are often modeled as Organization Fact Sheet subtypes (like "Team" or "Business Unit"), which are linked to applications, or as Subscription Roles (Responsible/Accountable) on the Fact Sheets themselves.
•API Usage: You can use the GraphQL API or the OData Integration to query these complex, multi-layered relationships in bulk.
 
You can then queries relationships between Process Fact Sheets (sub-scope items), Application Fact Sheets, and associated Organization/User Group data in bulk, mitigating manual effort/slow file downloads.
 
Do not hesitate to reach out to the following email to get further support: signavio_success@sap.com
Best,

entry.title: Re: How to Calculate VAT for PO and get in the Standard f...
entry.content:
Good day @Yathurshika_Sathiyavarman

The BAdI you are using has limited access to the pricing and tax condition values. Direct access to condition types like MWST is not provided in it.

The error you experienced often refers to improper syntax or usage of fields that are not available in that context.

You cannot directly retrieve Tax, Net or Gross Amount by using the BAdI you mentioned in public cloud because pricing data is not available at this enhancement point.

I recommend following the extensibility-compliant method:

Step 1:

Create a CDS view with I_PurchseOrderItemAPI01 and associate it with A_PurOrdPricingElement to retrieve condition values and filter it for VAT-relevant condition types in the CDS logic or within the Form.

Step 2:

You need to extend your PO Form Data Source. Use the Maintain Form Template Data Source Extensions. Here, choose MM_PUR_PO_OUTPUT, create a new extension by joining your CDS and the item and publish.

Step 3:

In the Manage Form Templates App, copy MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER, download the Adobe Lifecycle Designer, add your Custom VAT field and add sum logic for VAT in Adobe (e.g., JavaScript logic)

Step 4:

Finally upload the form template you modified back into the Manage Form Templates App, assign it to the MM_PUR_PO_OUTPUT type and ensure your communication arrangement and output channel are active.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to get ModelID in Signavio Process Governance?
entry.content:
Hello

The most likely cause of the "ModelID is not defined" error is that the modelID variable is not properly defined or not available in the JavaScript task. In Process Governance, workflow variables must be explicitly defined and selected before a script can use them.

  1. Check variable access in the script task, make sure modelID is selected in the task configuration. If it isn’t included as an input, the script cannot read it and the error appears.

  2. Make sure the Model ID is provided earlier in the workflow, for example by the workflow trigger or a previous action that passes the model ID and revision ID.

  3. Use the SAP Signavio Process Manager API client in your script, import the library, then query the model details using the modelID once the variable is correctly passed.

If this did not help please reach out to signavio_success@sap.com

Best,

entry.title: SAP Utilities Roadmap 2026 Onwards
entry.content:
The utilities industry will continue to play a key role in SAP’s strategy and product development. It is therefore important for us to keep customers, partners, and the entire SAP Utilities ecosystem informed about our planned innovations.

As in previous years, we have created a matrix outlining the relevant industry topics and their corresponding innovations. This matrix represents a selection of the most important innovations and does not claim to be exhaustive.

Additional innovations may be added over time, and delivery timelines remain subject to change. Following a high-level overview of the highlights, we provide detailed information for each topic. For nearly all innovations, a link to the SAP Roadmap Explorer is included for further details.

 

  • SAP Asset Performance Management:
    • Assessments for consequence classification of industrial system functions (Details)
    • AI-automated visual asset condition monitoring (Details)
  • SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud:
    • Graphical view for setting relationships between operations of one or multiple maintenance orders (Details)
    • Joule-based AI agents to propose optimized maintenance event for an asset to minimize operational disruptions (Details)
    • Support for the new Permit to Work (PTW) solution (Details)
  • SAP Field Service Management:
    • Management of measurement points on activity level (Details)
    • Dependencies between activities (Details)
    • Tool schedule visualization (Details)
    • Linear assets on the service map (Details)
    • Selection of multiple work orders through a lasso operation (Details)
    • Timesheet management in the partner portal (Details)
  • SAP Service & Asset Manager:
    • AI Assisted execution with Joule mobile client (Details)
    • Service assignment rescheduling support for field service technicians (Details)
    • Esri map improvements with breadcrumbing and draw-to-search capabilities (Details)
    • Support for the new Permit to Work (PTW) solution (Details)
    • Service assignment rescheduling support for field service technicians (Details)
  • Business Network for Asset Collaboration:
    • Integration of digital inspection checklists to support sharing with service providers (Details)
    • Modeling, sharing, and ERP system integration of failure catalogs and codes with causes and effects (Details)

 

  • SAP S/4HANA Utilities - Overall Topics:

    • Utilities Data Products (Master Data) (Details)
    • Archiving of installations and premises and deletion of unused device information records (Details)
    • Enterprise search for utilities master data (Details)
    • Continuous Influence (Details)
  • SAP S/4HANA Utilities - Metering:
    • Graphical display of utilities interval data (Details)
    • More flexible completeness check for profile values (Details)
    • Data Products and CDS views for energy settlement master data (Details)
    • Archiving of connection objects, device locations and devices (Details)
  • SAP S/4HANA Utilities - Market Process Management:
    • Utilities Data Products (Market Communication: process document header) (Details)
    • Utilities Data Products (Market Communication: transfer document header) (Details)
  • SAP S/4HANA Utilities - Contract Accounting:
    • SAP Fiori app for displaying the FI-CA document flow (Details)
    • Dispute resolution for missing payments (Details)
    • Dispute resolution agent for incorrect credits (Details)
    • Dispute resolution agent for missing credits (Details)
    • SAP Fiori app “Manage Contract Accounts” (Details)
    • OData v4 API for contract accounts (Details)

 

  • Customer Data Cloud:
    • Support for step-up authentication (Details)
    • Consent attributes connections – definition and maintenance of user-consent data (Details)
    • Ability to collect consent that is provided on behalf of a third party (Details)
  •  Emarsys:
    • AI-assisted campaign translator (Details)
  • CX AI Toolkit:
    • Shopping agent: related accessories based on product relationships (general availability) (Details)
  • Commerce:
    • Integration with SAP Omnichannel Promotion Pricing to display promotion recommendations on the product details page (Details)
  • CPQ:
    • Conversational AI support for quote handling (Details)
    • Integration with SAP Subscription Billing for a smooth quote-to-cash experience (Details)
  • Sales Cloud:
    • Promotion management (sales) (Details)
    • Maintaining marketing attributes for accounts, contacts, products, and registered products (sales) (Details)
  • Service Cloud:
    • Case priority prediction (service) (Details)
    • Case routing based on skills (service) (Details)
  • Sales and Service Cloud:
    • Additional features to support attachment search and management (sales and service) (Details)
    • Navigation to Custom UIs from a Mashup (sales and service) (Details)
    • Machine translation for notes (sales and service) (Details)
    • Home page AI capability for creating KPI cards (sales and service) (Details)

 

  • Distributed Energy Resources:
    • Enabling validation checks of instances through an API (Details)
    • Analytics for Long-Running Processes (Details)
    • Lightweight process for updating active measurement concept instances (Details)
  • Green Ledger:
    • Finance Intelligence: SAP Green Ledger (Details)
    • Connecting to several tenants of SAP Sustainability Footprint Management (Details)
    • Accounting for carbon allowances (CBAM) in a carbon journal (Details)
  • Sustainability Footprint Management:
    • Retrieving carbon flows from SAP Sustainability Footprint Management and posting them as allocations (Details)
    • Connecting to several tenants of SAP Sustainability Footprint Management (Details)
    • Supplier footprint integration with data exchange standards (Details)
  •  Sustainability Control Tower:
    • Cloud ERP Intelligence & Finance Intelligence: SAP Sustainability Control Tower (Details)
    • Data product for carbon journal entry (Details)

entry.title: How to Filter Current vs. Previous Year Data Using a Single Posting Date Input Control in SAP Analyt
entry.content:
Hi everyone!!

I’m working on a requirement in SAP Analytics Cloud where I need to use a single Posting Date input control to filter two different tables in a story. The first table should display data for the exact month selected by the user through that input control, while the second table should automatically show data for the same month in the previous year. Both tables use the same dimensions—G/L Account and Posting Date—and the measure Amount in Company Code. For example, if the user selects January 2025, the first table should show January 2025 data, while the second should show January 2024 data.

The challenge is that SAC applies the input control directly to the Posting Date dimension for both tables, and I need a way to “offset” the Posting Date filter by one year only for the second table. I’m looking for the best approach to achieve this,  any SAC feature that allows filtering one table based on a previous-year version of the selected date. If anyone has implemented something similar or knows an efficient workaround, I would really appreciate your guidance.

entry.title: Introducing AI-Powered Anomaly Insights & Recommendations in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP Integration Suite offers API Anomaly Detection that involves monitoring and identifying abnormalities in time series data related to APIs, enabling API Owners detect unexpected patterns or deviations from the norm, ensuring optimal performance and business continuity. Traditionally, resolving these anomalies has been time-consuming involving manual activities around impact assessment, root cause analysis & identification of mitigation plans.  

That’s about to change!

What’s New

SAP Integration Suite now brings AI-powered anomaly insights and intelligent recommendations to help you move from detection to resolution faster than ever. It improves troubleshooting efficiency and reduces manual investigation time. This feature leverages advanced machine learning models to identify anomalies and AI models to suggest actionable steps to fix them—empowering API Owners & developers to stay ahead of issues.

Note : The feature is in the process of getting updated in our global Data centres. Check this Note for information about regional availability.

Note : The availability of the Anomaly Detection & Intelligent Recommendations feature is dependent on your SAP Integration Suite service plan. Check this note for information about the various plans and supported features.

Key Benefits

  • Detailed Insights & Causes: Ready to use analysis of the Anomaly, its impact and the probable root cause(s)
  • Intelligent Recommendations: Get context-aware suggestions for quick resolution
  • Reduced Downtime: Minimize business impact with faster troubleshooting
  • Continuous Learning: Recommendations improve over time as the system learns from user feedback

Feature Overview

To assist API Owners who have enabled Anomaly Detection in their tenants with faster resolution of Anomalies, we introduce AI-driven analysis of the Anomalies.

When an Anomaly is detected, an advanced AI-model generates comprehensive insights on the event around the system state, clients involved, the intensity of the Anomaly etc.  It also then highlights the potential root causes for the Anomaly, which gives clarity on where the corrections/resolutions must be applied. Finally, it also provides a set of recommendations that the API Owners & developers can apply – both within & outside APIM systems - to resolve the issue at hand & also prevent future events.

Enablement

As an API Administrator of an SAP Integration Suite – API Management tenant, one could enable this new extension by just selecting an additional check box under Anomaly Detection settings. If you are switching on Anomaly Detection for the first time, then the check box is selected by default. You need to accept the Generative AI usage terms before starting to use the feature.

Anomaly Analysis

In the event of an Anomaly, if the Intelligent Recommendations has been enabled on the tenant, you will see three new tabs under the Anomaly details – Insights, Causes & Recommendations.

Insights: Delivers an in-depth analysis of unusual API traffic patterns, the system state during the anomaly, and its potential impact on API performance and stability.

Causes: Highlights the likely factors behind the anomaly by examining API usage trends, traffic variations, and underlying system conditions.

Recommendations: Offers practical steps and configuration adjustments to resolve the issue, enhance API performance, and implement preventive measures to avoid similar anomalies in the future.

In the example below, an API Traffic surge Anomaly has been detected. Observe how each of the tabs helps in getting clarity on the event itself & also quickly identify what could be done next.

For each of the generated content, feedback could be provided that helps the AI model learn over time & improve accuracy.

Summary

Instead of spending hours diagnosing issues, API owners can now rely on AI-driven guidance to resolve problems efficiently. This means less manual effort, fewer disruptions, and more time for innovation. More information could be found in our help documentation here.

entry.title: Re: How to Post Components Linked to a Subproduct in SAP...
entry.content:
Good day @sergio21 

Thank you for your question.

The reason for what you explained is, all component quantities in a production order are planned and adjusted in relation to the main product in public cloud by default. The BOM logic does not allow by-products or co-products to act as a reference to scale when consuming component. That means

  • You cannot directly assign a sub-BOM to a by-product.
  • The components you assigned to production will always scale based on the quantity of AAAA you reported and not SU01.

My recommendation would be to manually adjust quantities of SM01 and SM02 based on the quantity of SU01 before or during confirmation.  A pro to doing that is; you will not have to change your master data and it will work with your current process. A con is, it will require your manual effort and could be prone to error when you have a high volume.

Alternatively, if you must automate the logic, you may use a Custom CDS View or logic in your Manage Production Orders and trigger a Custom BAdI or CPI logic that adjusts component consumption which is based on the SU01 quantity. A con, is it will require some development because it is not an out-of-the-box solution.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to restrict specific materials for BOM only
entry.content:
BOM Component Restriction Configuration

To restrict material A1's BOM to only allow components B1, C1, and D1, you'll need to implement a combination of authorization controls and validation mechanisms, as this functionality is not available in standard SAP.

Recommended Approach: Authorization Group Control

Step 1: Configure Authorization Groups for Components

  • Navigate to MM01/MM02 for materials B1, C1, and D1
  • In the General/Plant view, assign a specific Authorization Group (e.g., "A1_COMP")
  • This authorization group should be unique to components allowed for material A1 [1]

Step 2: Set Up User Authorization

  • Configure user roles to only allow access to materials with the "A1_COMP" authorization group
  • Users creating/modifying A1's BOM will only be able to select from the authorized component list
  • Use transaction CS15 to verify the component usage list before BOM maintenance [1]

Alternative Solutions

Option 1: Transaction Variant (SHD0)

  • Create a transaction variant for BOM maintenance transactions (CS01/CS02)
  • Configure field restrictions to limit material input options
  • This approach works well for specific scenarios but requires careful setup [2]

Option 2: Custom Validation (Development Required)

  • Implement custom validation logic in BOM maintenance transactions
  • Create validation rules that check component materials against predefined lists
  • This requires ABAP development but provides the most flexible control [3]

Option 3: Source List Management

  • Maintain source lists for material A1 with only approved components
  • Block unauthorized materials at the procurement level
  • Use agreement references to control component selection [4]

Implementation Considerations

  • Standard Limitation: SAP doesn't provide native functionality to restrict BOM components to specific materials for a header material [1]
  • Authorization Impact: Ensure authorization groups don't conflict with other business processes
  • Maintenance Overhead: Consider the administrative effort required to maintain authorization groups

Best Practice Recommendation

Combine authorization group control with user training and process documentation. This provides both system-level restrictions and procedural safeguards while maintaining flexibility for legitimate business needs.

entry.title: Re: Automation of foreign payments in SAP S/4HANA Could P...
entry.content:
Foreign Payments Setup in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

1. DMEE Setup for Foreign Payments

Yes, DMEE setup is required for foreign payments. Here's how to configure it:

Step 1: Access Payment Medium Configuration

  • Navigate to Manage Your Solution → Configure Your Solution
  • Go to Application Area: Finance → Sub Application Area: Accounts Payable
  • Select Automatic Payments [1]

Step 2: Configure Payment Methods

  • Use activity Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region for Payment Transactions (SSCUI 101972) [2]
  • Define payment methods for foreign transfers (typically method 'L' for foreign transfer) [3]
  • Ensure the Payment Medium field specifies your DMEE format

Step 3: DMEE Format Tree Setup

  • Create or configure DMEE format trees for foreign payment file generation [4]
  • Map required fields including transaction currency, amount, payee details, and bank information
  • Configure exit modules if custom field mappings are needed [4]

2. Multi-Currency Bank Account Configuration

For suppliers with AUD local currency but requiring foreign payments:

Bank Determination Setup

  • Navigate to Set Up Bank Determination for Payment Transactions (SSCUI 101045) [1]
  • Configure bank determination based on Payment Method and Currency
  • Set up ranking order to automatically select appropriate bank accounts for different currencies [1]

Payment Method Configuration

  • In Set Up Payment Methods per Company Code for Payment Transactions (SSCUI 101044) [5]
  • Enable Foreign Business Partner Allowed checkbox
  • Enable Foreign Currency Allowed checkbox [6]
  • Check Customer/Vendor Bank Abroad Allowed if payments go to foreign banks

3. Customization Settings for Foreign Payments

Primary Configuration Path:

  • Manage Your Solution → Configure Your Solution
  • Finance → Accounts Payable → Automatic Payments [1]

Key Configuration Activities:

Currency and Country Settings

  • SSCUI 101972: Define currencies allowed and permitted destination countries for each payment method [6]
  • Specify which currencies can be processed with each payment method [2]

Company Code Settings

  • SSCUI 101044: Configure payment method restrictions and authorizations per company code [5]
  • Set amount limits and foreign payment permissions [7]

Bank Account Configuration

  • SSCUI 101045: Set up bank determination logic for automatic currency-based bank selection [1]
  • Configure multiple bank accounts for different currencies with proper ranking

Implementation Best Practices

Multi-Bank Currency Strategy

  • Maintain separate bank accounts for different currencies
  • Use bank determination to automatically select appropriate accounts based on payment currency
  • Configure ranking orders to prioritize specific banks for foreign transactions

DMEE Format Considerations

  • Use standard foreign payment formats where available (e.g., MT103 for SWIFT) [3]
  • Create custom DMEE trees only when standard formats don't meet bank requirements [4]
  • Test payment file generation thoroughly before production use [8]

Detailed Configuration Steps

I'd be happy to provide detailed step-by-step configuration guidance for your foreign payments setup. However, I need to understand which specific aspect you'd like me to focus on first:

Configuration Options Available:

1. DMEE Format Tree Setup

  • Creating custom DMEE format trees for foreign payment file generation
  • Field mapping and exit module configuration
  • Testing and validation procedures

2. Bank Determination Logic Configuration

  • Setting up automatic bank selection based on currency
  • Configuring ranking orders for multi-currency scenarios
  • Bank account assignment and prioritization rules

3. Payment Method Multi-Currency Setup

  • Enabling foreign currency processing
  • Configuring country and currency restrictions
  • Setting up amount limits and authorizations

4. Complete End-to-End Foreign Payment Process

  • Full walkthrough from supplier setup to payment file generation
  • Integration points and validation checkpoints
  • Testing scenarios and troubleshooting

entry.title: Re: How to activate the sales BOM configuration in public...
entry.content:
Good day @Matter 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference. Sales BOM &  Sales Order BOM for more details.

I found this Blog also quite insightful: Bill of Material Variants in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Sales – Scope Item 31Q ( ERLA, LUMF, CPFH, DISH )

The reason why you cannot see the BOM in “Configuration Item Category” is, the public cloud does not allow you to modify item category to enable Sales BOM functionality like you would in on-premise by setting structure scope or Explosion setting. This is a clean-core principle restriction.

You can enable Sales BOM functionality in public cloud by:

  1. Using BOM- capable Item Category Groups to maintain the material master for the header product with the ERLA for your assembled BOM or LUMF to package your BOM
  2. Using the Manage Bills of Materials App to create BOM
  3. Ensuring you create correct Material Master Setting (Header Material in Sales: Sales Org view & Component Materials)
  4. The system will the use item category instead of TAN automatically when BOM is exploded in sales order.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Самостійне навчання чи тренінг з фахівцем? SAP пропонує рішення для кожного
entry.content:
SAP пропонує широкий спектр навчальних формів та контенту — від самостійного онлайн-навчання з урахуванням індивідуального темпу до очних тренінгів з інструкторами, практичних воркшопів та структурованих програм сертифікації. Навчальні матеріали охоплюють різноманітні теми: бізнес-процеси, аналітику, розробку, хмарні технології та багато інших напрямків.

Портфоліо навчання SAP включає як безкоштовні програми та ресурси, так і платні пропозиції преміум-класу, залежно від глибини та формату навчання. Це дозволяє кожному користувачу вибрати оптимальний варіант відповідно до своїх потреб, можливостей та графіку навчання.

Окрім навчальних матеріалів, користувачі мають доступ до практичних середовищ та пробних систем, де можна власноруч працювати з продуктами SAP, виконувати вправи та перевіряти, як процеси виглядають на практиці. Це поєднує теорію з прикладним досвідом і допомагає закріпити знання.

Незалежно від того, чи ви клієнт, партнер чи студент, SAP інвестує у ваш професійний розвиток, даючи вам змогу впевнено крокувати в майбутнє технологій та бізнесу!

Дізнайтеся більше про всі доступні програми, формати навчання та можливості реєстрації у відеозаписі вебінару, а також прочитайте детальнішу інформацію у пресрелізах SAP:

  • Безкоштовне навчання від SAP: ще більше можливостей для розвитку

  • SAP надає безкоштовні освітні можливості для навчання студентам та викладачам

entry.title: Re: GL Open Items - Migration Cockpit - XREF1, XREF2, XRE...
entry.content:
Dear @Rajesh_Das,

In Public Cloud you can’t activate standard fields to force them into a Migration Cockpit template. The Migration Cockpit template is generated from the delivered migration object structure / released API.

For G/L Open Items, SAP delivered object structure simply doesn’t include Reference Key 1/2/3 (XREF1/2/3)

Option A (Recommended): Create 3 Custom Fields as the replacement. If the business goal is store 3 legacy reference values and report/filter later, do this:

  1. Custom Fields app
    • Create 3 fields for example YY1_REFKEY1, YY1_REFKEY2, YY1_REFKEY3
  2. Publish
  3. Back in Migration Cockpit app
  4. Re-download the template those custom fields should appear as new columns

This is the standard Public Cloud-safe workaround.

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/d5699934e7004d048c4801b552f3b013/dacc713629cb4518901f59fe9267000d.html?profile=20559621

 

Option B: Map the legacy values into a standard field that does exist in the G/L template if you only need the values for traceability

Option C: Raise SAP Incident about missing fields or accept a redesign option A or B

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: #COE MRAS 如何刷新Q系统数据
entry.content:
Dear @ericyu,

In Public Cloud the standard way to refresh Q (Quality/Test) with data from P (Production) is to use SAP Test Data Refresh

What the service does and key limits:

  • Refresh replaces master + transactional data in Q with fresh data from P
  • Business/technical configuration is not transferred so Q configuration remains only application data is replaced
  • The refresh runs on dates in the Test Data Refresh calendar Q downtime can be up to 24 hours
  • You can request multiple refreshes within the subscription period, subject to calendar availability SAP recommends requesting 4 weeks in advance
  • Integrations aren’t re-synced automatically technical connections remain, but data won’t be synchronized with connected systems unless you refresh/align them separately

More details below:

https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/s4hana-cloud-test-data-refresh/faq

Steps to do:

1. Subscribe / enable the service. This service requires an explicit subscription (typically arranged via your SAP account team)

2. Keep Q ready for refresh:

  • In the Q system run the Fiori app Check Your System Readiness Test Data Refresh regularly and resolve the action items
  • If you use extensibility, ensure your Handle Your Extensions app configuration is active/up to date before refresh

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F5778')/S35

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F6460')/S35

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/97cede126fba4a3f97e5daf0c322e582.html

3. Request each refresh in SAP for Me (repeat per cycle)

  • Go to SAP for Me ->Services & Support ->Service Requests ->New Service Request
  • Search for SAP S/4HANA Cloud: TEST DATA REFRESH, add the service, select Source = P, Target = Q, pick an available date from the TDR calendar and choose whether to use depersonalization

More details below:

https://support.sap.com/content/s4m/help/support/sr.html?anchorId=section_2114245213

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/70a3253a3beb411c8fe626ec504ec436.html

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Enable custom fields for Situation Handling (Service Contract Due to Expire Soon)
entry.content:
We are currently implementing the Service module in Public Cloud and are facing a requirement to add custom fields to the Situation Handling described in the Help documentation below:
Service Contract Due to Expire Soon | SAP Help Portal


I would like to share the approaches we have considered and the outcomes:

1. Extending the CDS view used by the standard Situation Handling
Our analysis showed that this Situation Handling is based on the CDS view C_SrvcContrItmExpryDetsSitn. However, since this CDS view is not released for extension, adding custom fields is not possible.

2. Implementing a custom Situation Handling based on CDS view I_ServiceContractCube_2
This CDS view is useful because it provides visibility into the remaining time until contract expiration (e.g., 3 weeks before, 2 weeks before).
We attempted to implement a similar custom Situation Handling based on this view; however, the challenge is that it does not expose the “Auto Renewal” indicator. As a result, there is a risk that notifications would be triggered even for contracts that are automatically renewed.

3. Implementing a custom Situation Handling based on CDS view I_SERVICECONTRACTENHCD
This CDS view provides the contract end date, but we encountered the same limitations as in #2.
Additionally, since the date is stored as a DEC type, it is not suitable for conditions such as “NEXT 90 DAYS.”

Based on the above, I would like to ask product development or experts who may have addressed similar requirements:

  • Is there any plan to release C_SrvcContrItmExpryDetsSitn or to enable field extensibility for this CDS view in alignment with custom field extensions?

  • If not, is there a plan to provide templates or sample implementations for custom Situation Handling, similar to those available in other modules?

  • If neither is planned, are there alternative CDS views better suited for this requirement beyond the ones in #2 and #3?
    If not, and a custom CDS view is necessary, which CDS views would you recommend combining to meet this requirement?

We appreciate your support and any guidance you can provide.

entry.title: My SAP TechEd 2025: Special SAP Community Moments
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

My name is Moshe Naveh from the SAP Community team. Today I would like to share with you the exceptional experience I had in SAP TechEd Berlin and Bangalore 2025. There isn't a more suitable day to do so but my 16th SAP Community anniversary which is today. Joining the SAP Community back in 2009 enabled me to attend multiple SAP TechEds as I’ve shared in this post. However, this year was my best SAP TechEd year so far! Want to know why? please keep reading below:).

Before we dive into the details of my amazing SAP TechEd 2025 journey, I would like to invite you to an online gathering where we will continue the SAP TechEd magic! SAP Community members will share their personal SAP TechEd experience and highlights and also learn how to quickly share it on the SAP Community using the AI based Simplified blogging methodology. If you're interested in joining, please Email me at community@sap.com and I'll send you more details (currently we're planning for upcoming Thursday, but we'll see what works for everyone).

SAP TechEd Berlin

SAP TechEd Berlin was my first SAP TechEd event after 7 years. That was the case for many people. You could really feel how eager people were to meet again in person. There is something in face to face meeting that you cannot sense via a virtual interaction. During the event I was mainly in the SAP Community booth. It enabled me to do something I really enjoy when meeting SAP Community members and that is to interact, share ideas and insights, smile and laugh and just have good time together. It is what the SAP Community and my community passion is all about. I was also very happy to meet community members who participated in our SAP TechEd speakers series and hear how the simplified methodology helped them:

Sunny Kapoor who spoke about Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

and 

Stephanie Jerch and Christian Niedermayer who had a session about "Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action"

Then I really enjoyed also telling people about the SAP Community Hobbies series and even got some new contributors to join it!

Marla Alschweiki who will share about her lovely dog and more!

And 

Patricia who will share about her lovely hobbies (more details to come!:))

I was also fortunate to finally meet in person community members I've been working with for years, such as KP who does terrific things related to database and analytics in the SAP Community 

One my main challenge during the event was not to eat too much (remember this line! You will hear it again)!

We had a great photographer on site who helped people get their perfect profile picture!:  

 I think it came out nice;):

and talking about photos, one of the things you wonder about during such events after you have not been to them for a while is what changed. I know Christian Braukmuller didn't change!: 

     Exact spot, 11 years and not much changed:)

One of the most important aspects for me in such events is meeting my team! 

Here in the picture awesome SAP Community members and some of my amazing team members, among those responsible for the great community magic during SAP TechEd (including team members not in the picture, holding the fortress back in the office:)) 

      

 

And I couldn't ask for a better last selfie for SAP TechEd Berlin just before I headed home:

         

SAP TechEd Berlin was great and prepared me for the wow experience I was about to have in SAP TechEd Bangalore.

 

SAP TechEd Bangalore

 

So after two weeks break at home, I was fortunate to travel again to SAP TechEd Bangalore. I haven't been to India for a long time as well and I enjoyed every moment in it:).

One of the first things I did after I landed was to go and eat. I was both hungry but I also really missed the Indian food!

I went for the spiciest dish in the menu:

and here you can see the steam on sunglasses from how spicy the food was! (I thought it just happened in cartoons:)) :

Then, after resting a bit from the travel I've reached what I was really after and that was meeting everyone in SAP TechEd Bangalore!

I was so happy meeting everyone and I started taking selfies with SAP Community members to have a memory of those great meetings! Interestingly enough, the second person that I saw and knew, was Jitendra Kansal:

   

Jitendra is an old friend and we first me back in 2012 during my first SAP TechEd ever and after Jitendra was one of the main people who helped me successfully launch and expend the blog it forward challenge!:  

      

 then I got to my booth and I fell in love with the setup. I loved the big touch screen TV and space we got to freely interact and engage with amazing people. When I explained to people who heard about the community for the first time, I was excited as them. Showing different places on the community on the big touch screen made it feel to me like dancing!:

 

It was two amazing days where I didn't stop talking about the great things that are happening in the SAP Community. I met so many great people and existing/new friends. Not many know but it was the first time I did such an engaging interaction in the booth which included a lot of jokes and interesting stories about the SAP Community and myself. Josh Bentely well described as being an educational entertainer! I enjoyed so much talking about my passion to the SAP Community and at the same time making people happy and laugh:):

I admit that I was very moved by the energy and the great spirit of the next generation of the SAP Professionals:

And I also talked about the SAP Community hobbies and was able to prove to the world how go of a painter @Sandra_Solis is (whom I was very fortunate to meet with in Berlin and we agreed we won't forget to take a selfie next time:):

Vitaly is showing how he looks alike his coffee drawing by Sandra Solis

and another great photo filled with community spirit:

 

And talking about community spirit, the Developer advocates rocked it during the entire event (also in SAP TechEd Berlin):

I love the Indian culture! I love the people, food, music and dance! Couldn't think of a better way to finish my own personal SAP TechEd tour with a great show and dancing like no one is watching:):

So SAP TechEd 2025 was an amazing experience that we all, and especially me, were waiting for so long. I'm sure that you and I will see fruits of the great SAP Community booth interactions and that I will stay in touch with my new SAP Community friends.

Looking forward to seeing all of you in the SAP Community and in future events!

Please join us, SAP Community members and the Community team for an SAP Teched gathering where we will connect, share experiences and learn how to quickly share them in the SAP Community. Please Email me at community@sap.com if you would like to join the gathering.

Please share in the comments section how was SAP TechEd for you and if you have picture of us together, please share!:)

entry.title: Re: Enable custom fields for Situation Handling (Service...
entry.content:
Service Contract Situation Handling Extension Options

Based on your detailed analysis, I understand the challenges you're facing with extending the standard "Service Contract Due to Expire Soon" situation handling. Let me address your questions systematically:

Current Limitations Analysis

Your assessment is accurate regarding the standard CDS view limitations:

  • C_SrvcContrItmExpryDetsSitn is not released for extension [1]
  • I_ServiceContractCube_2 lacks the Auto Renewal indicator
  • I_SERVICECONTRACTENHCD has date format limitations for time-based conditions

    Recommended Solutions

    Option 1: Custom Situation Object Creation

    Create a custom situation object using the Manage Situation Objects app [1]:

    Step 1: Design Custom CDS View

    • Combine I_ServiceContractCube_2 with contract master data views
    • Include Auto Renewal indicator from service contract header data
    • Convert date fields to appropriate formats for time-based conditions
    • Add your required custom fields

      Step 2: Configure Situation Object

      • Navigate to Manage Situation Objects app [1]
      • Create new situation object with your custom CDS view as the structure
      • Map semantic keys (Contract ID, Item Number) for unique identification
      • Configure value help services for filter conditions [1]

        Step 3: Set Up Events and Actions

        • Define workflow events relevant to contract expiration scenarios
        • Configure actions for situation handling (notifications, approvals, etc.)
        • Link navigation targets to relevant service contract apps

          Option 2: Enhanced CDS View Combination

          Recommended CDS Views to Combine:

          • I_ServiceContractCube_2 (for time calculations)
          • I_ServiceContract (for header-level Auto Renewal indicator)
          • I_ServiceContractItem (for item-level details)
          • Your custom extension fields through appropriate extension views

            Implementation Approach:

             

             
            -- Example structure for custom CDS view
DEFINE VIEW ZC_ServiceContractExpiry AS SELECT FROM
  I_ServiceContractCube_2 AS cube
  INNER JOIN I_ServiceContract AS header
    ON cube.ServiceContract = header.ServiceContract
  INNER JOIN I_ServiceContractItem AS item
    ON cube.ServiceContract = item.ServiceContract
    AND cube.ServiceContractItem = item.ServiceContractItem
{
  cube.ServiceContract,
  cube.ServiceContractItem,
  cube.ValidityEndDate,
  header.AutoRenewalIndicator,
  // Add custom fields here
  // Time-based calculations for expiry conditions
}
WHERE header.AutoRenewalIndicator = '' // Exclude auto-renewal contracts
             

            Product Development Considerations

            Regarding your specific questions:

            1. C_SrvcContrItmExpryDetsSitn Extension: While I cannot provide definitive roadmap information, consider submitting an enhancement request through SAP Influence channels for releasing this view for extension

            2. Template Availability: Custom situation handling templates are typically provided through the Manage Situation Objects app [1], which offers the framework for creating custom implementations

            3. Alternative Views: The combination approach using I_ServiceContractCube_2 with contract master views appears to be your best option currently

              Implementation Best Practices

              Custom Field Integration:

              • Ensure custom fields are properly exposed through released extension points
              • Use appropriate data types for time-based condition evaluations
              • Implement proper authorization controls for sensitive contract data

                Performance Optimization:

                • Include appropriate indexes on key fields (Contract ID, Expiry Date)
                • Consider data volume and query performance in CDS view design
                • Test with realistic data volumes before production deployment

                  Testing Strategy:

                  • Validate Auto Renewal logic thoroughly
                  • Test time-based conditions (30/60/90 days before expiry)
                  • Verify custom field display and filtering functionality



                    Detailed Implementation Guidance

                    I'd be happy to provide detailed step-by-step guidance for your Service Contract Situation Handling implementation. To give you the most relevant and actionable instructions, could you please specify which aspect you'd like me to focus on:

                    Available Implementation Paths:

                    1. Custom CDS View Creation & Combination

                    • Detailed SQL structure for combining I_ServiceContractCube_2 with master data views
                    • Field mapping and data type conversion techniques
                    • Auto Renewal indicator integration logic

                      2. Custom Situation Object Configuration

                      • Step-by-step walkthrough using Manage Situation Objects app
                      • Semantic key mapping and value help configuration
                      • Event and action setup procedures

                        3. Enhancement Request Structuring

                        • How to format and submit requests for C_SrvcContrItmExpryDetsSitn extension
                        • Required documentation and business justification templates
                        • SAP Influence channel submission process

                          4. Complete End-to-End Implementation

                          • Full development lifecycle from CDS view creation to situation object deployment
                          • Testing procedures and validation checkpoints
                          • Performance optimization and authorization setup

entry.title: Re: #COE MRAS 如何刷新Q系统数据
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 系统刷新方案

在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition环境中，由于只有Q系统和P系统，无法进行传统的系统刷新操作。以下是针对您需求的解决方案：

当前限制说明

系统刷新限制

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition不支持从P系统刷新Q系统数据 [1],[2]
  • 出于安全考虑，生产数据不应出现在开发环境中，因为开发人员可能看到业务关键数据
  • 出于技术考虑，Q到P的刷新会导致Q系统数据量急剧增加，从而导致变更项目中Q系统停机时间大大延长

推荐的测试策略

分阶段数据迁移测试方法

  1. 单元测试阶段 - 在Q系统中加载较小的数据集（采样数据，如10%的数据或测试用例中使用的数据）
  2. 重复采样测试 - 在Q系统中为下一个测试周期重复采样
  3. 完整数据加载 - 在Q系统签署后，在P系统中加载完整数据 [1]

可用的替代解决方案

1. Test Data Refresh (TDR) 服务

订阅TDR服务

  • SAP提供Test Data Refresh服务，用于将生产系统的最新数据更新到测试系统
  • 该服务提供最新的、去个人化的测试数据，用于实施新功能时的业务测试
  • 需要额外的许可订阅，请联系SAP销售代表获取更多信息 [3],[4]

TDR服务特点

  • 支持主数据和事务数据的迁移
  • 提供去个人化功能
  • 确保测试租户反映生产租户的最新应用数据

2. 配置数据同步

业务角色传输

  • 可以从Q系统导出业务角色并导入到P系统
  • 使用Export Software Collection和Import Collection应用程序
  • 虽然不能传输用户数据，但可以传输角色配置 [5]

3. 特定数据类型的同步选项

会计数据变更调度

  • 使用Schedule Accounting Data Changes应用程序
  • 支持在公司代码级别进行主数据变更
  • 可以清理Q系统中不需要的测试数据 [6]

实施建议

最佳实践组合

  1. 订阅TDR服务 - 获得定期的生产数据刷新能力
  2. 采用分阶段测试策略 - 使用采样数据进行初步测试
  3. 配置自动化数据清理 - 定期清理Q系统测试数据
  4. 建立数据治理流程 - 确保测试数据的质量和一致性

时间规划考虑

  • TDR服务需要提前预约时间段
  • 考虑业务测试周期和数据刷新频率的平衡
  • 建议参与SAP Community Test Data Refresh讨论获取更多经验分享 [3]

您是否希望我详细说明TDR服务的订阅流程，或者帮助您制定适合您业务需求的测试数据管理策略？

entry.title: SAP Business One Mobile App Login Failing After Upgrade to FP 2405 (Processing Failed Error)
entry.content:
Dear All,

We are experiencing a critical issue with the SAP Business One Mobile Application, where all users are unable to log in on both Android and iOS.

The mobile app version currently in use is 1.2.18.

Error Message (Mobile App)

“Processing Failed. Internal Server Error. Contact your system administrator.”

System Landscape

  • SAP Business One 10.0 for SAP HANA
    Version: 10.00.250 – FP 2405 (64-bit)
  • Integration Framework (B1iF) version 1.22.57
  • Deployment: On-premise, physical server located at the customer site

The mobility setup was fully working before the upgrade from version 2105 → FP 2405.
The issue only started immediately after the upgrade.

Configuration Details (Verified)

  1. SLD Configuration

B1i Server

  • Company Database: B1DI and JDBC connections configured
  • All connectivity tests successful

wsformobile

  • WSAN, WSAS, WSAR configured with correct associated server IP
  • Using port 8080
  • destHost configured correctly
  • All connectivity tests successful

B1IA Server

  • HTTA and HTTP (associated server IP) configured
  • Connectivity tests successful

B1IADB

  • JDBC connectivity configured
  • Connectivity tests successful
  1. Scenario Configuration
  • sapb1mobile scenario is fully configured
  • Scenario package activated
  • All scenario steps and tasks are running without errors
  • Enforce Secure Transport has been set to false as we are using port 8080
  1. User & License Setup
  • Mobility users created correctly
  • License assignments completed
  • Device IDs  set up in SAP B1
  • Mobile configuration on the SAP B1 application side appears correct
  1. Connectivity Status
  • SAP B1 Application ↔ Integration Framework connectivity via destHost over port 8080 is successful
  • Integration Framework is reachable internally and externally
  • However, mobile login still fails with the same “Processing Failed” error
  1. Certificates
  • A self-signed certificate was generated correctly
  • Imported and applied according to SAP guidelines
  • No certificate trust warnings on either Android or iOS
  1. Integration Framework Troubleshooting Tool

Manual tests performed on:

  • B1 Mobile (iOS)
  • B1 Mobile (Android)

All tests passed successfully:

  • Connectivity
  • Authentication
  • Certificate validation
  • Service availability
  • Endpoint checks

No errors were reported.

SAP Notes Already Followed

We have already completed all troubleshooting steps from the following SAP Notes:

  • 1924930 – SAP Business One Mobile App for Android
  • 1602674 – SAP Business One Mobile App for iOS

Including:

  • Endpoint validation
  • Reverse proxy checks
  • Certificate validation
  • Testing URLs directly in browser
  • Checking mobile service HTTP responses
  • Reviewing B1i logs and mobile service logs

All checks passed successfully.

Current Situation

Despite:

  • ✔ Correct SLD setup
  • ✔ Successful B1iF connectivity
  • ✔ Scenario package activated and running
  • ✔ Integration tests successful (iOS + Android)
  • ✔ Certificate setup validated
  • ✔ No issues before upgrading

The mobile app still cannot authenticate and always returns the “Processing Failed. Internal Server Error” message.

Request for Assistance

Has anyone experienced a similar issue after upgrading to SAP Business One FP 2405 where the Mobile App login fails although all B1iF configurations and tests are successful?

We are specifically looking for insights regarding:

  • Additional configuration steps required for FP 2405
  • Known issues or patches related to mobile services after upgrading
  • Changes in mobile endpoints or certificates introduced in 2405
  • Required B1iF updates or notes specific to mobile scenarios
  • Any logs or components we may have overlooked

Any guidance, recommendations, or related SAP Notes would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors & SIEM Integration
entry.content:
SuccessFactors SIEM Integration Options

Based on the current SAP landscape, here are the available approaches for integrating SuccessFactors with SIEM solutions:

Current Integration Challenges

Audit Log Retrieval API Status You're correct that the dedicated "Audit Log Retrieval" API for SuccessFactors appears to have been removed from the Q4 2025 roadmap. This creates a gap for direct SIEM integration capabilities [1].

Available Integration Approaches

1. Custom Integration via SuccessFactors APIs

OData API Integration

  • Leverage existing SuccessFactors OData APIs to extract audit-relevant data
  • Use Integration Center for API-based data extraction without middleware [2]
  • Configure scheduled data pulls for security events and user activities
  • Transform data into SIEM-compatible formats (JSON, CEF, LEEF)

Implementation Approach:

  • Identify relevant SuccessFactors entities (User, Role, Login events)
  • Create custom integration flows using available APIs
  • Schedule regular data extraction and transformation
  • Push formatted logs to SIEM via REST APIs or file drops

2. SAP Enterprise Threat Detection (ETD) Integration

ETD as Intermediary While there's no out-of-the-box SuccessFactors-ETD integration, you can build custom connections using ETD's provided interfaces [3]:

  • Utilize ETD's REST APIs for log ingestion
  • Configure ETD to normalize SuccessFactors data
  • Forward processed events to your primary SIEM solution

3. File-Based Integration Methods

Export and Transfer Approach

  • Configure SuccessFactors to export audit logs to secure file locations
  • Use SIEM agents to collect and parse log files
  • Implement proper file encoding handling (common SIEM integration challenge) [4]

Considerations:

  • Ensure proper file format compatibility with your SIEM
  • Address encoding issues that may prevent SIEM agents from reading files
  • Implement secure file transfer mechanisms

4. SAP BTP Audit Log Integration Pattern

Leverage BTP Integration Capabilities Following the pattern used for SAP BTP SIEM integration [5]:

  • Use SAP BTP as an integration layer
  • Configure audit log forwarding from SuccessFactors through BTP
  • Implement JSON-based log formatting for SIEM consumption
  • Utilize communication scenario patterns similar to SAP_COM_0750 [6][7]

Implementation Recommendations

Immediate Solution:

  1. API-Based Custom Integration - Most viable current approach
  2. Use Integration Center for simplified API connectivity [2]
  3. Implement JSON formatting for SIEM compatibility
  4. Schedule regular data extraction to maintain near real-time visibility

Long-term Strategy:

  • Monitor SAP roadmaps for restored audit log APIs
  • Consider SAP's broader SIEM integration strategy as it evolves
  • Evaluate ETD integration as SAP's security ecosystem matures

Best Practices:

  • Implement proper error handling and retry mechanisms
  • Ensure data privacy compliance when extracting audit information
  • Test thoroughly with your specific SIEM solution's parsing capabilities
  • Document custom integration for maintenance and updates

entry.title: Re: billing tax code determination incorrect after saving
entry.content:
Root Cause Analysis

Based on your description, the tax code determination is correct initially but changes after saving the billing document. Here are the most likely causes:

1. Pricing Type Configuration Issue

Check Copy Control Settings

  • Navigate to Define Copying Control for Delivery Document to Billing Document [1]
  • Verify the Pricing Type setting in the copy control configuration
  • If set to "G: Copy price elements unchanged and redetermine taxes," this could cause tax redetermination [2],[3]

Recommended Action:

  • Review pricing type settings to ensure they align with your business requirements
  • Consider using pricing type "D: No redetermination; only re-evaluation" if you want to preserve original tax codes

2. Material Tax Classification Triggers

Master Data Validation

  • Verify Material Tax Classification in the material master (Sales: Sales org. 1 tab) [4],[5]
  • Check if multiple tax classifications are maintained that could conflict [6]
  • Ensure tax classification consistency across all relevant fields

Customer Tax Classification

  • Review Customer Tax Classification in customer master data (Sales Distribution > Billing view) [4],[5]
  • Confirm the combination of customer and material tax classifications produces the expected tax code

3. Condition Record Analysis

Tax Condition Investigation

  • Use VK13 to verify tax condition records (MWST/TTX1) are correctly maintained [7]
  • Check if condition records have the correct tax code assignments
  • Verify condition validity dates and organizational assignments

Pricing Analysis

  • Use Pricing Analysis in the billing document to trace tax determination logic [7]
  • Navigate to: Billing Document > Environment > Pricing > Analysis
  • This will show exactly how the tax code was determined

4. Custom Logic Interference

BAdI Implementation Check Even though you mentioned no BAPI customization, verify these areas:

  • SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER BAdI for billing document data transfer [3]
  • BIL_DOC_ITEM_CONTR parameter structure modifications [6]
  • Any custom pricing formulas or routines

Diagnostic Steps

Step 1: Immediate Analysis

  1. Open billing document in change mode (VF02)
  2. Go to Environment > Account Determination Analysis [8]
  3. Check tax condition determination path
  4. Compare with sales order tax determination

Step 2: Pricing Investigation

  1. Access Conditions tab in billing document
  2. Select tax condition line
  3. Use "Analysis" function to trace determination logic [7]
  4. Document any differences from sales order analysis

Step 3: Master Data Verification

  1. Check material master tax classifications [4]
  2. Verify customer tax classifications
  3. Confirm condition records in VK13
  4. Validate tax code setup in FTXP

Recommended Solution Path

Immediate Fix:

  • Manually correct tax classification in billing document item details (Billing Document tab > Tax Classification field) [9]
  • Use pricing type "G" to redetermine taxes with correct classification

Long-term Resolution:

  • Review and correct master data inconsistencies
  • Adjust copy control pricing type settings if needed [1]
  • Implement proper validation in custom logic if applicable

entry.title: How to check the configuration when the document is not shown in the cash flow statements report?
entry.content:
How to check the configuration when the document is not shown in the China New Localization Cash Flow Statements based on Offsetting Account Determination Solution?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to check the configuration when the document is n...
entry.content:
Refer to the following steps to check the configuration:

  1. Check whether the ledger and the company code have been activated in the configuration activity Activate Online Offsetting Account Determination for Several Countries/Rgns (ID 105333).
    If you need to configure the specific document types, open this configuration activity. Choose one ledger and double click Define Company Code, and then choose one company code and double click Define Version, and make sure the document type has been maintained under the Type tab. If you leave this tab as empty, it means that all document types are activated.
  2. Check whether the missing documents were posted before activation.
    If so, you can use the app Determine Offsetting Accounts for Unprocessed Journal Entries to process journal entries for which offsetting accounts were not determined previously.
    If not, continue to check whether the G/L accounts in the FI documents have been maintained in the configuration activity Define Cash Flow Statement Versions for Several Countries/Regions (ID 105331).
  3. In the direct cash flow statement, if you need to trace the purpose of cash flows with retrospective clearing relationship in document chain, configure all account types: Cash Account, Offsetting Account, and Invoice Account in the configuration activity Define Cash Flow Statement Versions for Several Countries/Regions (ID 105331). Please also make sure that the specific G/L accounts are assigned to all these three account types and for offsetting account (Acct Type), the G/L account is the vendor or customer's reconciliation account .

3377775 - How to check the configuration when the document is not shown in the cash flow statements report? - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Posting in 0C Ledger
entry.content:
Good day @Percipere 

Yes, you are right about the YSC. In public cloud, the account keys are limited due to the clean-core approach. So, only a few account keys are provided for posting purposes.

  • That means you cannot create new account keys.
  • Any condition that uses same account key (e.g., YSC) will be mapped to one G/L account for each company code or valuation level.
  • Therefore, GL posting is account-key not condition-type dependent

Since you cannot add a second account key, my recommendation is to:

  • Use separate Valuatio Areas. If the conditions are meant for different company codes or valuation areas, you can assign different G/L accounts for each valuation level for YSC. 

However, this does not help if both conditions are in the same company code or ledger.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Discrepancy Between Merit Guideline and Merit Field V...
entry.content:
This is not uncommon and expected behavior.   The reason is that your guideline is a percentage and the default based on the rating is also a percentage, however, the system only saves an amount.  As a result, the system will take the default percentage and apply that to the basis of the increase, usually an annual salary, a base rate or a target amount.   The system will multiply the basis of the increase by the percentage and calculate an amount of increase which is then used to recalculate the percentage.  Because of rounding the percentage can be off just a little as in your case, 4.5% is now 4.49%.   This usually is more of an issue with smaller amounts like hourly rates.

Please go through the math as I described above and confirm this is the case.  If not, reply to the post and with some additional details and I can try to further clarify.

entry.title: Re: Cloud ALM Health Monitoring - Filter ABAP.ResponseTim...
entry.content:
Edit: I found this obvious limitation has been identified by SAP and there is an improvement requested:

  •  3609786 - Can SAP Cloud ALM Health Monitoring metric ABAP.ResponseTime be split so that Dialog and Batch types have separate thresholds? - SAP for Me
  • Improvement Request Details - Customer Influence - Define thresholds in "ABAP.ResponseTime" per task type

----------------------------

Hi @paula_augedahl , what Christoph meant, and I faced the same issue now, is to configure the alert only for type of process.

I have batch processes with very long response time per design, but this is fine, nobody is waiting. But the thresholds defined in the Configuration seem to trigger an alert for any process type above the threshold. I only want alerts to trigger if Dialog or HTTP are above 5 seconds for example, but not for BATCH or RFC.

Additionally, it's not clear how the threshold is calculated, I couldn't find documentation.

  • Does it do an average for a period of time? What is the period of time then?
  • Does it calculate the average for all process types and all application servers? Or a single application server and a single process type trigger the alert already?

In Integration & Exception monitoring for Cloud Integration this has been solved properly, you can define period of time, number of messages and processing time limit. For the alerts in health monitoring, it would be good to be able to specify process type + period of time to calculate the average, otherwise they are not useful at all.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - ACDOCA-ACDOCU Custom Field Release Universal Journal
entry.content:
In the profitability report created by the CO module, the field with the technical name WW001_PA exists, and this field also exists in the ACDOCA table. In order to bring this field into ACDOCU, a new field named ZZ1_PA_WW001_MSE was created in ACDOCA for the WW001_PA field, and a real-time replication was set up between the two fields. In other words, whenever a value is posted to the WW001_PA field in ACDOCA, the same value can also be seen in the ZZ1_PA_WW001_MSE field.

After that, according to the ‘How to Execute Field Extension of ACDOCU_1909_V6’ document, the ZZ1_PA_WW001_MSE field was created in the ACDOCU table via the Custom Fields Fiori application (inline with ACDOCA). However, the step using transaction OXK3 was not performed. Currently, the field exists in both tables with the same name, but RUJ does not transfer any data for this field.

When we tried to add an additional mapping in the ‘Data Release Task: Define Mapping for Journal Entry to Group Journal Entry Fields’, we received a CX Root Error during the RUJ process.

Could this be because the ZZ1_PA_WW001_MSE field created in the ACDOCA table was not generated using transaction OXK3?

entry.title: Re: API to post customer invoice with automatic tax calcu...
entry.content:
Good day @khanhlynx99 

Yes, you are right that the API you mentioned supports creating FI documents like DR, DG but this does not support automatic tax determination or calculation. You must explicitly provide the tax amount.

You can work around this by calculating tax externally when you use the Advanced TAX API simulation service, then pass tax amounts in your payload. A possible process could be:

  • You call Tax Simulation API which you can find through backend integration,
  • then parse the response and extract tax details.
  • Then construct full journal entry payload with correct tax line items.

Note that you cannot expect tax determination within the API_JOURNALENTRY_SRV. You have to handle it outside.

Alternatively, you may consider raising a feature request with SAP Customer Influence to expose tax simulations as part of the journal entry API.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP クリーンコア拡張性ガイドと日本のユーザーに向けた実践のためのお薦め
entry.content:
1. クリーンコアとは何か・SAPが提唱するクリーンコアの概要を理解する。

クリーンコアとは？

クリーンコアとは、SAPの業務システムを「標準機能を最大限活用し、必要な部分だけを安全に拡張することで、システムの複雑化や技術的負債を防ぎ、将来のアップグレードやイノベーションを容易にする」という考え方です。

もう少しだけ補足すると、 “企業のERP（基幹業務システム）を「標準化」「拡張性」「データ品質」「統合」「運用効率」の5つの原則で最適化し、継続的なビジネス変革とイノベーションを支えるための指針”です。過度なカスタマイズやサイロ化したデータ、非効率な運用を排除し、標準機能を最大限活用しつつ、必要な差別化は拡張機能やAPIで柔軟に実現します。

クリーンコアというと、今日のメインテーマである「拡張性」の部分だけが注目されがちですが、その他にも重要な検討・実行要素があることをまずは理解してほしいと思います。

クリーンコアはなぜ必要？

その必要性については、すでに何度も様々な場面でお伝えしていますが、従来型のオンプレミスERPは、標準化の欠如、過剰なカスタマイズ、データ品質の低下などがイノベーション（デジタル変革の加速、競争力維持、リアルタイムな意思決定、俊敏性・柔軟性の確保が現代企業の課題）の障害となっています。クラウドERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud）をクリーンコア戦略で導入することで、運用コスト削減、迅速なアップグレード、AIや最新技術の活用が可能となり、ビジネス価値を最大化できます。

クリーンコアの５原則

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

#　

クリーンコアの5原則　　　　　　　　　　　　

内容　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

1

Business Process　　　　　(ビジネスプロセス)

o     標準プロセスを最大限活用し、差別化が必要な部分のみ拡張。　　　　　　　　　　　　　

o    カスタマイズは最小限に抑え、TCO（総所有コスト）削減とビジネスアジリティ向上を実現。　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

2

Extensibility (拡張性)

o     標準機能から外れる拡張は、SAPが提供するAPIやBTP（Business Technology Platform）を活用し、コアシステムから分離。

o    拡張のガバナンスを徹底し、技術的負債を管理・最小化。

3

Data (データ)

o    データ品質・ガバナンス・保護・効率性を重視。

o    クリーンなデータ基盤を構築し、AIや分析の精度向上、運用コスト削減、法令遵守を実現。

4

Integration (統合)

o    標準化されたAPIやイベント駆動型アーキテクチャで、システム間の連携をシンプルかつ堅牢に。

o    継続的なモダナイゼーションとガバナンス体制の確立。

5

Operations（運用）

o    ガバナンス、Toolchain、継続的改善、セキュアな運用、アジャイルなデリバリーを推進。

o    ITとビジネスの連携を強化し、変化に強い運用体制を構築。

 

どうやってクリーンコア度合いを測る？

  • クリーンコアの成熟度やガバナンス状況を評価し、KPIで進捗を可視化。
  • RISE with SAP Methodologyダッシュボードで、拡張状況やデータ品質、統合状況などを一元管理し、継続的な改善を支援。

 

どうやって進める？

  • 標準プロセスの採用とプロセス階層の整理。
  • 拡張要件のガバナンスと技術的負債の管理。
  • データガバナンス組織の設置、データ品質評価・改善サイクルの導入。
  • 統合アーキテクチャの設計とモダナイゼーション、CoE（Center of Excellence）の設置。
  • 運用面では、ツールチェーンの統合、アジャイル開発、セキュリティ基準の遵守、リリース管理の徹底。

クリーンコア戦略を採用することで、標準化と拡張性のバランスを保ちつつ、イノベーションの迅速な導入、運用効率化、AI・分析活用、セキュリティ強化を実現し、継続的なガバナンスとKPI管理により、変化に強い企業基盤を構築できます。

では、どこから手をつければいいのでしょうか？指針だけだとこれを現場で実践するには、具体的に何をすればいいのか悩んでしまうところがあるかもしれません。そこを補完し、実践すべきアクションやその実行方法やツールについて説明しているのが、「クラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条」です。これはクリーンコアに取り組むには、「何から始め、どう進めるか」を解説している日本市場向けの（SAPジャパンの紹介している）実践フレームワークです（※この基本五箇条の概要については後段で解説します）。

では、ここから本日の主題である「拡張性：Extensibility」＝”SAP クリーンコア拡張性ガイドと日本のユーザーに向けた実践のためのお薦め”の内容に入っていきたいと思います。

これを取り上げる理由は、過去に個別最適化を進めた結果としてERPのアップグレード作業・プロジェクトの負担を大きなものにしてきた大きな一因が、アドオンだからです。多くのお客様の悩みのスタートポイントがここであり、この問題へのアプローチの今を理解し、クリーンコアへ取り組むことが最適であると考えたからです。

 

 

2. クリーンコア：従来の3層型の拡張モデルとは

SAP S/4HANAの拡張性に関する従来のガイドラインは、以下の3つの層（Tier）で整理されていました。

  • Tier 1（公開API/拡張ポイントのみ）
    SAP    が公式に公開・保証するAPIや拡張ポイントのみを使った拡張（最も推奨される）
  • Tier 2（ラッピング/間接利用）
    直接は非推奨なオブジェクトやAPIをラッピングして間接的に利用
  • Tier 3（クラシック拡張/直接参照）
    SAP    内部オブジェクトや非公開API、モディフィケーション等、将来の互換性リスクが高い拡張

特徴：

  • 「Tier 1」以外は原則非推奨で、Tier 2/3は“やむを得ない場合のみ”という扱い。
  • 実際の現場ではTier 2/3の利用が多く、現実とのギャップが課題でした。

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

3. クリーンコア：new  Clean Core Extensibility Guide（レベル型）の特徴

3-1. 「レベル型」への進化（A～D）

レベル　　

内容　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

代表的な技術・特徴　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

A

公開API・拡張ポイントのみ利用　（最も推奨）

SAP Build（ABAP Cloud, CAP, Low/No Code）、SAP BTP、公開API

B

クラシックAPIやフレームワー（安定性は高いが契約保証なし）

BAPI、クラシックABAP、ALVなど

C

SAP内部オブジェクト（将来リスクあり）

非公開関数、内部テーブル等

D

推奨されない拡張（noAPI、直接書き込み、暗黙的拡張など）

noAPI、直接書き込み、暗黙的拡張

3-2. 現場適用性の向上

  • B/CレベルとしてクラシックABAPやラッピングも現実的な選択肢に昇格
  • レベルごとにリスク・推奨度・対応策を明確化
  • KPIやガバナンス、ツール（ABAP Test Cockpit等）を活用し、継続的なクリーンコア化を支援

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

4. 3層型と レベル型 (New) の比較・進化ポイント

比較表 

観点　　　　　　　　　

従来の3層型　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

 New Clean Core Extensibility Guide （レベル型）　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

分類

3段階（Tier 1/2/3）

4段階（A/B/C/D）でより細分化

Tier 2の扱い

ラッピングは“やむを得ない場合のみ”

Bレベルとして現実的な選択肢に昇格

クラシックABAP

原則非推奨

B/Cレベルとしてリスクを明示しつつ現実的に許容

リスク管理

“非推奨”の一括り

レベルごとにリスク・推奨度・対応策を明確化

KPI/ガバナンス

明確な指標なし

KPIやガバナンス、継続的改善サイクルを明示

現場適用性

理想論に寄りがち

レガシーや現場の実態も考慮した現実的な枠組み

 

進化のポイント：

  • 多くの現場でクラシックABAPやラッピングが現実的に使われている
  • 一律に“非推奨”とするのではなく、リスクを可視化し、段階的な改善を促す
  • KPIやガバナンス、ツールを活用し、継続的なクリーンコア化を支援

 

 

5. クラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条との関係

SAPジャパンが日本のユーザー・パートナー向けに、クラウドERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud等）の価値を最大化し、プロジェクトを成功に導くために継続的に取り組むべき5つの検討テーマを明文化したものです。（※この章の以下の内容は、DXEYEセッションにて実施しているクラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条セッションの内容を元にしています）

基本五箇条の全体像

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

それぞれの条項について

1. Clean Coreコンセプトに則った拡張開発

検討ポイント１：既存アドオン資産（カスタムコード）の分析・評価

  • SAP S/4HANAへの移行にあたり、必ずしも全てのカスタムコードを修正する必要はありません。
  • 最低限、クリティカルな影響を受けるカスタムコードのみ修正を施すことで移行のコストを下げることができます。
  • 評価には、ABAP Test Cockpit、SAP Fiori App Custom Code Migration Tool の利用を推奨しています。
  • このツールについては、こちらのブログで詳しく説明されています。

検討ポイント２：アップグレード時の影響方法が大きい拡張方式の廃止

  • モディフィケーション、暗黙の拡張/拡張スポット、コピーアドオン、バッチインプットなどは要注意です。このような手法はアップグレード時の影響が大きいため、段階的にでもいいので廃止・極力数を減らす検討することをお勧めします。


検討ポイント３：SAP S/4HANA拡張方式の適切な選択

  • SAPが提供している拡張開発手段は、並列で見るのではなく、検討する順番があります。

  • アドオン（カスタムコード）の新規開発・再設計を検討するときには、その目的や対象ユーザ、ERP側との結合性など合理性がある判断基準を元に考える必要があります。


検討ポイント４：ABAP Cloud開発モデルの適用

  • 最も新しい４つ目の拡張開発手段であるABAP Cloud（開発者拡張やBTP側にあるABAP Cloud 環境を利用）の活用が、重要になってきます。段階的に Clean Core 化を進めるため、ABAP Test Cockpit を使用して、ABAP Cloud 開発モデルに準拠したチェック・開発を行います。このSAP認定資格を取得するエンジニアの方の数が年々増えています。
  • 詳しいガイドはこちら
  • この開発も、SAP Build AppsやBuild Process Automation, Business Application Studioなど同様にSAP BuildのLobbyから行うことができますし、Joule for Developersのリリースにより、開発者のAIサポートにより利用のハードルがどんどん低くなってきていることも良い流れです。

 

 

2. UX（ユーザー体験）の向上
  • 古い技術に基づく専用クライアント SAP GUI は、複雑な画面構成のため習熟には時間を要し、デバイスは限定され、個別 PC での管理が必要。
  • 各ユーザーが担当業務に必要な情報を得るために多くの個別画面でのチェックが必要になり、担当業務の状況を俯瞰することが困難。
  • 生成 AI などの最新技術を活用し、各ユーザーに最適化された画面構成で効率的に業務を行うために UX のモダナイゼーションが必要。

検討ポイント１：ビジネスロールに基づく新しい SAP 標準 UX の導入

  • デバイスにとらわれず、自身のロールに基づいて、単一エントリーポイントから SAP S/4HANA の SAP Fiori アプリケーションや情報にアクセスし業務を迅速に開始することが可能になります。
  • KPI など業務全体において一目でわかるように設計されたタイルからの“気づき”により詳細確認・アクションへとスムースに繋げる業務ナビゲーションを実現します。これにより、ユーザーは迅速に業務を行い効率を上げることができます。

検討ポイント２：顧客要件に基づく カスタム Fiori アプリの開発・導入

  • 1. でも紹介した LC/NC ツールを使用したドラッグ&ドロップでの開発に加え、プロコードツールでも AI によるコード生成、テンプレートベースでの新規画面作成やガイドつきの開発機能、スクラッチベースでの開発など様々な要件に応じてカスタムアプリを開発することができます。

検討ポイント３：社外アクセス、セントラルアクセスポイント/アプリケーションポータルの導入

  • SAP S/4HANA だけではなく、複数の SAP クラウドアプリケーション、SAP BTP 上に開発したカスタムアプリケーション、その他のアプリケーションなど業務に必要な情報に単一のポイントからアクセスすることができます。　
  • これらはいずれも SAP BTP 上のサービスであり、社内外からのアクセスが可能でマルチデバイスに対応し、場所にとらわれず柔軟に業務を行うことが可能にします。

検討ポイント４：デジタルワークプレイスの構築、社外ユーザーへの情報共有

  • SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition の機能に加えて、ドキュメントの管理や検索機能などやチーム運営、コラボレーションにおいて必要な機能を提供しデジタルワークプレイスを構築できます。
  • LC/NC でのビジネスサイトの構築が可能で、豊富な事前定義済みのコンテンツで迅速にポータルを開発することがきます。
  • 社内向けポータルだけではなく、サプライヤー向けなどの社外ポータルとしても活用が可能です。

これらの実現には、BTPだけではなく、SAP AI ナビゲータであるJouleや、Digital Assistant Platform WalkMeなどが関係してきます。

 

 

3. ビジネスプロセスの最適化
  • 情報を個票として管理することなく、リポジトリとして管理を一元化することで、関係者全員が End-to-End で共通認識を持つことを可能に。
  • ビジネスプロセスを“作る”ものではなく、継続的な改善サイクルの中で“使う”ものとすることで、情報の鮮度を維持、付加価値を向上。

検討ポイント1：SAP Best Practice を起点とした Fit to Standard

  • SAP Signavio Process Navigator や、SAP Signavio Process Explorer 上の SAP Best Practices を参照し、Clean Core の実現に向けた Fit to Standard ワークショップを実施します。
  • 要件定義や基本設計フェーズにおける議論の精度を向上、成果物作成を効率化するだけでなく、設計/開発/テストおよび運用を含めた後続フェーズにおける高度活用を可能とします。

検討ポイント2：ビジネスプロセスの自動化および ERP と他システム間のプロセス連携

  • ビジネストランスフォーメーションを進めるうえでビジネスプロセスの自動化は外せないテーマです。ユーザ企業は単一の ERP システムだけですべての業務が遂行できるわけではなく、他のシステムとの連携が必要です。
  • SAP Integration Suite、SAP Build Process Automation はSAP が提供するビジネスプロセスの統合および自動化基盤で、SAP が50年以上にわたり培ってきた業界・業種のビジネスプロセスの深い専門知識に基づいて事前定義されたコンテンツを提供し、「開発」プロジェクトから「活用」プロジェクトへのシフトを支援します

検討ポイント3：ビジネスプロセスを効率的に実行するハイパーオートメーション

  • デジタルかつ継続的なビジネスプロセスの改善サイクルは、業務上のボトルネックを容易に検知するだけでなく、AI により改善アクションを提案し、RPA でアクションを実行させることが可能となります。
  • 合言葉は、
    「Signavioで発見して、SAP Buildで作って（繋げて）、SAP Integrationで繋げる」　

 

です。

検討ポイント4：ビジネス目的/レイヤに合わせた最適な可視化

  • ビジネス活動を可視化するビジネスアナリティクスにおいても、レイヤに応じた分析視点/粒度でビジネスを可視化することで、より正確で効率的なビジネス状況の理解/活動の評価が可能となります。
  • また、可視化は一過性/局所的な視点ではなく、継続性/全体的な視点で議論を行うことが大切です。

 

4. データ利活用の高度化

検討ポイント１：SAP S/4HANA のデータをリアルタイム分析

  • SAP S/4HANA の標準ユーザーインターフェースである SAP Fiori には、業務検討テーマに沿った分析画面や、多次元レポートが組み込まれており、業務オペレーションとレポーティング/分析を分けずに、１つの画面から業務に必要とされる操作を行うことが可能です。
  • 各業務で見るべきデータから、データを見た後の後続処理をそのまま実行できるように画面がデザインされており、SAP S/4HANA の利用ユーザは誰でも、この革新的なインターフェースを利用することができます。

検討ポイント２：SAP S/4HANA と連携した統合財務計画

  • SAP S/4HANA と SAP Analytics Cloud を組み合わせて利用することで、SAP S/4HANA とシームレスに連携できる統合予算管理機能を提供します。
  • 同一マスタを利用した予算編成、リアルタイムな進捗確認、シミュレーションによる着地予測など、予算管理業務を包括的にサポートし、経営計画・業務計画と整合性が取れた、より高度な経営管理モデルの実現に寄与します。

検討ポイント３：意思決定を支援するデータ利活用基盤の構築

  • SAP S/4HANA が持つ基幹業務データと、社内外にある多種多様なデータを一貫した基準で統合し、より価値あるデータ利活用の実現をサポートするため、 SAP Datasphere を利用できます。
  • データ利活用ためのビジネスコンテキスト（データの関連性、意味合いなど）を損なうことなく、データ連携・統合ができるため、正確な業務データを迅速にユーザに提供でき、意思決定のスピードと精度の向上に寄与します。

検討ポイント４：データ利活用を促進するデータガバナンスの実現

  • 企業が持つ価値あるデータを効率的に管理し、データの検索、共有、理解を支援するための、レポートカタログおよびデータカタログ機能を提供します。
  • データの正確な情報源を証明し、企業におけるデータの意味、定義、利用用途を一元管理することが可能です。
  • 信頼のおけるデータをユーザに提供できることで、データを活用したコミュニケーションを促進し、データ活用文化の醸成に貢献します。

 

 

5. アプリケーションライフサイクル管理の効率化
  • 継続的なデジタル変革を実現するためには、ビジネス要件に対するアプリケーションの実装と運用のサイクルを迅速に繰り返し回していく必要があります。
  • しかし、標準化されておらずクラウドに最適化されていない導入プロジェクト管理では、ビジネス要件を実現する開発オブジェクト間の不整合や大きなテスト工数等により、実装期間の長期化、遅延が発生しがちです。
  • また、個別の運用管理が工数とコストを消費し、戦略的 IT 業務へのリソースシフトを妨げている場合もあります。

検討ポイント1：SAP 標準導入方法論に準拠した導入プロジェクト管理　SAP Activate 導入方法論とプロジェクト管理基盤 SAP Cloud ALM

  • SAP Activateは、Fit to StandardアプローチとBest Practiceを活用し、アジャイル手法を取り入れたSAP標準の導入方法論です。これにより、クラウドソリューションの迅速な導入と継続的なイノベーションを支援します。
  • SAP Cloud ALMは、SAP Activateのタスクテンプレートやガイドを活用し、導入プロジェクトを一貫して管理します。Fit to Standardワークショップから設定・変更のデプロイ、テスト準備や自動化ツールとの連携まで、効率的なアプリケーションライフサイクル管理を実現します。

検討ポイント2：一貫した CI/CD, 変更・移送管理基盤の構築　SAP BTP CI/CDサービス、SAP Cloud ALM

 

  • SAP BTP CI/CDサービスでコード変更を自動で構築・テスト・デプロイし、開発からリリースまでのサイクルを短縮します。
  • SAP Cloud ALMで、SAP BTPとSAP S/4HANAの移送管理と連携し、拡張アプリとIn-App拡張を一元管理を行い、変更・承認プロセスの一貫性を確保し、移送の集中管理を実現します。

 

検討ポイント3：影響分析とテストの自動化　SAP Application Testing Solutions by Tricentis

  • システムの新規設定および変更による影響が大きいオブジェクト＝リスクの高いオブジェクトの特定から、変更に対するテストの自動化を通して、業務プロセスおよび機能の実装スピードを向上し、継続的なビジネス変化への対応を支援します。

検討ポイント４：運用コスト削減を実現するソリューション　SAP Cloud ALM 運用管理

  • SAP Cloud ALM は SAP S/4HANA Cloud をはじめ各種クラウドアプリケーションと SAP BTP を含むクラウドソリューションの導入と運用を支援する、アプリケーションライフサイクル管理の統合ソリューションです。
  • SAP Cloud ALM の運用向けの機能では、ビジネスプロセス実行の KPI 監視、システム間統合の監視、ユーザー視点での性能の可視化、ジョブ監視、ヘルス監視等を提供し、マルチクラウド環境下での安定稼働と運用コストの低減を実現します。

 

さらに、RISE with SAP Methodology （SAP Activateに基づいたClean Core実践のための導入方法論）や SAP Tool Chain （企業のクラウドERP移行やデジタルトランスフォーメーションを支援するために設計されたSAPおよびパートナー製ツール群の統合エコシステムです。単なる個別ツールの集合ではなく、戦略策定から運用までを一貫してサポートする仕組み）などの利用を検討することで検討と実現を加速することが可能になります。

 

関係性：

  • Clean Core Extensibility Guideが示す原則・レベル分けを、五箇条のTipやツール・サービスを活用して現場で実践することが、プロジェクト成功の近道です。
  • 五箇条は、現場での実践やプロジェクト推進に役立つ具体的な検討テーマ・Tipを整理したガイドラインであり、クリーンコア戦略の現場適用を強力にサポートします。

 

６. 実践のためのガイドラインとおすすめリソース

  • SAP Application Extension Methodology：拡張アーキテクチャ設計のためのフレームワーク
  • SAP Cloud ALM：要件管理・トレーサビリティ・ガバナンス強化
  • ABAP Test Cockpit：自動コードチェックとクリーンコアレベル判定
  • SAP Build：AI活用のローコード／プロコード開発環境
  • SAPジャパンの支援サービス：現状分析・方針策定・設計・運用・DX推進まで、各フェーズに応じた多様なサービスを提供

参考リンク：

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-cloud/why-abap-cloud
  • https://www.sap.com/products/erp/rise/methodology/clean-core.html
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-guidance-framework/sap-application-extension-methodology/sap-application-extension-methodology-overview
  • https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/build.html
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-developers-guide/what-is-btp-developers-guide?version=Cloud

 

7. まとめ

  • クリーンコア戦略（Clean Core Extensibility Guide）は「原則・全体像」
  • 旧3層型ガイドラインと比べて、より現実的・実践的な枠組みへ進化
  • 基本五箇条は「現場での実践Tip・検討テーマ」
  • 両者を組み合わせて活用することで、SAP ERPプロジェクトの成功と継続的なイノベーションを実現できます
