entry.title: Data not visible of BIN and storage type wise stock - S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear SAP support Team,

We require a consolidated report covering the following fields: Material, Plant, Storage Location, Warehouse Number, Batch, BIN, Stock Type and Stock.

Kindly suggest the standard SAP application or CDS view or query for reporting this data.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Data not visible of BIN and storage type wise stock -...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud provides several applications for stock visibility, but none delivers all required fields—material, plant, storage location, stock type, warehouse number, and bin details—in a single consolidated report. The Stock – Multiple Materials app covers basic inventory information, while Display Storage Bin and the Warehouse Monitor provide warehouse and bin-level visibility. These need to be used together, as the stock app does not include warehouse details.

Available CDS views (such as I_SerialNumberStockSegment, I_ML_BALANCE, and I_ProductStorageLocation) also cover only part of the dataset and cannot generate a unified report through standard functionality.

To achieve full visibility, the recommended approach is to combine the existing SAP applications:

  • Use Stock – Multiple Materials for core stock data.
  • Use Display Storage Bin or the Warehouse Monitor APPs for warehouse/bin information.
  • Correlate the data manually when both views are needed together.

If a unified report is required, a custom CDS view or an enhancement request via Customer Influence may be considered, since no standard solution currently provides all fields in one output.

For implementation, ensure the correct business roles are assigned (e.g., SAP_BR_INVENTORY_MANAGER, SAP_BR_WAREHOUSE_CLERK) and retrieve warehouse details through the bin display applications.

Resources

  • Stock – Multiple Materials (SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library)
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/aff0b3f5f46c42a2b2c0fabfc233bab2/f27e02758591469fa489705a1d212df4.html

  • App Extensibility: Stock – Multiple Materials
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/d451f280bc3646bb9c3cb0ac37acc34e.html

  • Display Storage Bins (Fiori App Reference) — https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/?appId=%2FSCWM%2FLS03 fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com

  • Warehouse Monitor (Fiori App Reference) — https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

  • Creating Custom CDS Views (Custom CDS Views app)
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/b0000072fe994d7b9d5e015adf066059.html

  • Virtual Data Model and CDS Views in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/8573b810511948c8a99c0672abc159aa.html

  • Inventory Analysis Overview
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/2deffbe9d21f4b5fb1f998e9834019d1.html

  •  ##2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Product.

Best Regards,

SAP Support.

entry.title: What to Expect at the SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference 2026
entry.content:
Toulouse Awaits: What to Expect at the SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference 2026

We’re delighted to announce the SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference 2026, taking place April 21–23 in Toulouse, France. This year’s event promises three days of insight, collaboration, and innovation, bringing together leading energy and utilities organizations, industry experts, and SAP partners.

Why Attend?

The conference is your opportunity to:

  • Learn from industry leaders about their transformation journeys.
  • Explore cutting-edge SAP solutions driving modernization and sustainability.
  • Network with peers and experts shaping the future of energy and utilities.

Customer Success Stories

We’re proud to welcome an impressive lineup of SAP customers who will share their strategic insights, lessons learned, and real-world impact. Confirmed speakers include: Gaz Électricité de Grenoble (GEG), BC Hydro, TEAG, X-ELIO, Xoserve, Ipiranga, MB Energy, Tennet, Socar, and more. 

These sessions will cover topics such as grid modernization, digital transformation, renewable integration, and how SAP solutions enable exceptional customer experiences.

Deep-Dive Workshops

Alongside customer presentations, you’ll have access to hands-on workshops and interactive sessions focused on the latest technologies and best practices. Key themes include:

  • SAP RISE and GROW
  • Distributed Energy Resources (DER)
  • Customer Experience (CX)
  • Asset Management
  • Oil, Gas & Energy

These workshops provide practical insights and direct access to SAP product experts, industry analysts, and peers taking place on April 21.

New in 2026: Energy & Utilities Innovation Awards


We’re excited to introduce the Energy & Utilities Innovation Awards, celebrating organizations driving transformation through innovation, collaboration, and customer excellence.

Award Categories:

  • Artificial Intelligence (AI) – Strategic use of AI for intelligent operations.
  • Innovation – Forward-thinking initiatives creating new opportunities.
  • Best Team Success – Exceptional teamwork delivering outstanding outcomes.
  • Transformation – Bold projects redefining business models.
  • Customer First – Elevating customer experience and measurable value.

Entries close: Friday, March 27, 2026
Submit your nomination here. Winners will be announced live during the conference in Toulouse!

Join Us in Toulouse

With inspiring customer stories, expert-led workshops, and the debut of the Energy & Utilities Innovation Awards, the SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference 2026 is set to be an unforgettable event.

Check the official conference website and secure your spot today with the Early Adopters’ Rate: Limited time offer – Expires January 15, 2026!

We look forward to welcoming you to Toulouse in April 2026—and to celebrating the people and ideas driving the next generation of energy transformation!
